creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by H. Ed Robison, in memory of his beloved wife Ulrike Pietzner Robison
description: four horizontal images on one sheet; each image has light grey ground; standing figures (one seated) in Middle Eastern dress, with men wearing turbans and hats and women wearing burkas; some children and a donkey; received mounted together with L2013.104.86 and 2013.29.436
dimension:
1 1/4 × 3 13/16 in. (3.18 × 9.68 cm) (image, Left image)
1 1/4 × 3 7/8 in. (3.18 × 9.84 cm) (image, second image from left)
1 1/4 × 3 7/8 in. (3.18 × 9.84 cm) (image, second image from right)
1 1/4 × 3 13/16 in. (3.18 × 9.68 cm) (image, Right image)
3 × 19 3/4 in. (7.62 × 50.17 cm) (sheet)
marks:
Signature and Inscription

inscription LL margin LRC below image, in pencil: [Toshi Yoshida]
medium: Woodblock print; ink and colors on paper
title: Peoples of India
